intro: Calvelia pterantha, commonly known as the featherleaf calvelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
